Entry.1: - Left by Train from Charing Cross, reached Boulogne at 5pm stayed night at Hotel De Paris.
Entry.2: -Reached Battalion at Henneveaux at noon by car - went to Brigade Dinner Party - Australian nurses present.
Entry.3: - Church parade - visited "D" Coy's billets - all Corp much dispersed in area.
Entry.4: - Went to Bde HQrs to lecture by Wisdom on French Army - afternoon inspection by W very good - selected best Platoon. Wrote Doff.
Entry.5: - Meeting of CO's at Bde. HQrs. Robinson went on leave - went for a ride.
Entry.6: - Church parade, went for a long ride with Lloyd.
Entry.7: -Went to Boulogne to play football - match off - returned at 9.45 p.m.
Entry.8: -Route March 15 miles, walked all the way. Wrote to Doff.
Entry.9: - Div Boxing Competitions, stadium in this area, I judged.
Entry.11: won by two firsts & one second, rained in afternoon.
Entry.12: -Snowing & raining. Bn marched to Rifle Range but unable to shoot (10 miles).
Entry.13: - Snowing & raining, had a game of bridge, wrote to Doff.
Entry.14: -Church parade, went for a long ride, very cold weather.
Entry.15: -Battalion to Rifle Range at Escoulles - very good shooting under bad weather conditions.
Entry.16: -More Shooting - Bn very good indeed, had a game of bridge.
Entry.17: -Went by car to Boulogne, had dinner & returned about 11 p.m.
Entry.18: - Orders to move forward received, Bn cleaning up.
Entry.19: - Left Henneveaux at 5 a.m. and entrained at Desvres, arrived at Steenwerck at mid-day, took over from Goddard at Canteen Corner, very Dirty camp.
Entry.20:
- Cleaning up - men resting, officers reconnoitred 
for
 forward areas.
Entry.21: -Formed Bn Mess again. Reconnoitred area around Nieppe.
Entry.22: - Two Coys working, two training, had a game of cricket. Two letters from Doff - Billie has been sick.
Entry.23: -Robinson back from leave took over raiders. Going to musketry demonstration tomorrow. Wrote to Doff.
Entry.24: - Left by car to Bailleul then by train to St. Omer & bus to Musketry School at Nordbecourt arrived about 5.30 p.m.
Entry.25: - Saw students at work and some demonstrations, dined at night with Thelander who is at the school.
Entry.26: - More demonstrations & revolver competitions, very good concert at night.
Entry.27: - Left by bus for St. Omer,no trains owing to shelling Hazebrouck - left St. Omer by car & arrived home at midnight.
Entry.28: - Quiet day - saw Colette, had a concert at night.
Entry.29:
- Orders received to relieve 19th Bn. Finals of boxing competitions - won 
all
 the brigade contests.
Entry.30: -Collett going to England, am taking charge of Brigade - "C" Coy. Concert at night very good.
Entry.31: -Raining heavily all day - relief postponed, had a game of bridge.
Entry.32: - Left by car at 6 a.m. to reconnoitre front - heavy gas shelling by Hun. Took over Bde Front from the "Old Bde".
Entry.33: -Feeling a bit off color from effects of gas. Saw Ralston re vickers.
Entry.34: - Went around whole support line with Read of Engineers. Hun Offensive Between Arras & St Quentin begun.
Entry.35:
- Took over neucleus Garrisons from 5th Bde. Went around



Chalmers sector with Harry. Saw G.O.C Division re new dispositions.
Entry.36: -Went around "B" Bn Sector with Pearson. Letter from Bas, wrote Doff & Bas.
Entry.37: - Went around Corps Line with Read, withdrew personnel for Div Res.
Entry.38: - Saw "A" Bn sector again - saw Smythe. Martin took over - Div under orders to go South.
Entry.39: - Cut down all Officers Kit to minimum. Saw General's Grave. Letter from Doff.
Entry.40: -Went over for ride, had a fall from "Mickie" who has broken both knees.
Entry.41: -Went around lines with Martin who hasn't improved much.
Entry.42: - Went for walk around Neuve Eglise, making all arrangements for shift.
Entry.43: - Went for a ride & had a glass of wine with Little at "Ye Olde Kicking Mule".
Entry.44: - Moved to Aldershot Camp. Bn relieved in line by South Lancashires.
Entry.45: - Moved by circuitous route to Meteren by Bus - billeted.
Entry.46: - Heavy day entraining early in morning, bought some lace for Doff.
Entry.47: - Left Meteren at 3 a.m. entrained at Caestre 6 a.m., arrived Amiens 9 p.m. marched to Allonville.
Entry.48: - Marched to La Neuvelle & billeted for night.
Entry.49: - Marched to Bazieux & relieved Imlay's lot, moved forward to support at night relieving Christie.
Entry.50: - Raining heavily all night. Hun shelling all day, about 10 casualties.
Entry.51: -More enemy shelling, 2 Coys digging support Line - wrote Doff.
Entry.52: - Quiet Day, had meeting of Coy Cdrs, more digging at night.
Entry.53: -Taking over tonight from Currie - very cold day.
Entry.54: - Miserable day, went up to posts at night,good deal of M.G. Fire.
Entry.55: - Men working well, weather better - visited posts.
Entry.56: - Attempted raid but failed, one casualty, enemy very alert.
Entry.58: - Wired half front & commenced to connect posts. Wrote to Doff.
Entry.59: -Finished wiring & connecting posts, dug a C.T. Herbert killed.
Entry.60: - Relieved by Currie - moved back to Support.
Entry.61: - Remained in support. 2 Coys digging in front area.
Entry.62: -Relieved by Dawson, moved back to Reserve, one Coy bathed. Two letters from Doff.
Entry.63: - Birthday - cable from Doff. Had a good dinner in a cellar. Wrote Doff.
Entry.64: - Orders to move into line & take over all Bde front.
Entry.65: -Took over from Currie & Chalmers. Went around line.
Entry.66: - Quiet Day - usual shelling - men working well.
Entry.67: - Heavy shelling on front - few casualties & a bit of gas.
Entry.68: -Letter from Doff. InterCoy relief - Hun keeping low.
Entry.69: - Put in a good night wiring along front.
Entry.70: - Finished second belt of wire. Orders for relief by 28th€‹.
Entry.71: - Relief cancelled, 25th took over part of line - being relieved by Tommies. Wrote Doff.
Entry.72: - Relieved by Buffs, at midnight marched back to Behencourt arriving at 3 a.m.
Entry.73:
- Left Behencourt at 3 p.m. & moved to Pont Noyelle , road over to Bussy about 6 to see Madam Domart

who has gone to Paris.
Entry.74: - Moved to Camon, I reconnoitred the front South of Somme arriving home tired after 20 mile ride.
Entry.75: - Men had a good rest. Officers reconnoitring. Huns bombed Amiens but did little damage.
Entry.76: - Reconnoitred area between Glisy & Nicholas - moved to vicinity of Glisy.
Entry.77: - Wisdom back - had dinner with 25th who celebrated 1000 days service.
Entry.78: - Had a few casualties by premature explosion of big French Gun.
Entry.79: - Letter from Doff - also Wrote Doff. Bn digging & reconnoitring.
Entry.80: - More reconnoitring & digging also Training, wrote to Bas.
Entry.82: -Moved to Fransvillers arriving at 9 p.m. had a game of bridge.
Entry.84: - Enemy shelled village, two civilians killed.
Entry.85: - Reconnoitring - had a game of cards with the Yanks. Wrote Doff.
Entry.86: - "D" Coy detached working "C" Coy. Concert & Supper very pleasant Evening.
Entry.87: - Saw Martin & Paton at Heilly. Had game of bridge.
Entry.88: - Went to Bde HQrs, letter from Bas, reconnoitring - D Coy returned.
Entry.89: -Off color with touch of malaria. Officers reconnoitring.
Entry.90:
- To Bde - Paton doing stunt tomorrow at Ville Sur Ancre.



Heavy rainstorm flooding trenches etc.
Entry.91: -Parcel from Florrie, Sent Doff some Lace, Wrote Doff.
Entry.92: -Orders received & Battn moved into Reserve in Ribemont area.
Entry.93: - Reconnoitred area - Battn working at night - saw Wisdom re left flank.
Entry.94: -Visited by Yank General. Battn. working at night.
Entry.95: - Battn working at night. Hun Gas shelling for two hours.
Entry.96:
-Order to relieve front on Sunday received.

Raining heavily - men all working.
Entry.97: - Letter from Doff. Wrote to Doff. Moving into line tomorrow night.
Entry.98: - Relieved Raper in Line, had an amusing relief, no casualties.
Entry.99: -Went around line, had a fight in No Mans Land - very warm.
Entry.100: - Visited by G.S.O. III Army showed him front - did a good nights digging.
Entry.101: -Went around front with Lee - Bn working very well.
Entry.102: - Went around line with Wisdom, line now connected up.
Entry.103: -Battalion relieved suddenly by Brazenor, moved back to Fransvillers .
Entry.104: -Meeting of C.O's at Bde re stunt. Saw Yanks again.
Entry.105: - Reconnoitred Martin's front - very tired on return, saw Sadler, Beiers, Forbes, & Christie.
Entry.106: - Bn working, visited 6th Fld Ambulance, had long talk with Robinson re Thorn.
Entry.107: - Meeting of C.O's at Bde re stunt, taking over from Martin's tomorrow. Wrote to Doff.
Entry.108: -Took over from Basil's old Bn., no casualties - now in Reserve.
Entry.110: -Gas shelling at night, digging again, otherwise quiet.
Entry.111: -More digging, orders received for Stunt - Bn in Reserve.
Entry.112: - Moved into position before daylight & remained quiet.
Entry.113: - All ready for stunt, 4 officers wounded, fight commenced at 9.45 p.m.
Entry.114: - All objectives taken, 300 prisoners, M.G. & mortars - own casualties very small. Hun shelling all day.
Entry.115: -Feeling off color, sent for Robinson. Wrote to Doff, went to Transport lines.
Entry.116: - Shelled all night, went by car to Div with Paton, then on to Beateaucourt saw Wynter at Corps.
Entry.117: - Very sick, saw M.O. Walked to St. Ouen, turned in early.
Entry.118: - Very sick stayed in Bed, Bn. relieved.
Entry.119: - Better, joined Bn at Frechencourt, still a bit seedy.
Entry.120: - Stayed in bed all day,made appln. to be returned to Australia.
Entry.121: -Saw Wisdom, walked down to Transport lines, had a game of Bridge.
Entry.122: - Had a few strikes at cricket - visited each Coy. Letter from Doff.
Entry.123: - Inspection by Wisdom, very good turn out, reconnoitring. Wrote to Doff.
Entry.124: - Jumping contest against RHA, we won.
Entry.125: - Went for a long ride. Had a game of Bridge.
Entry.126: - Letter from Doff, played cricket, made 18 against menV officers.
Entry.127: - Went to Bde during Wisdom's absence, to Concert Party at night after reconnoitring V.B. front.
Entry.128: - Conference of C.O's at Rivery, returned to Bn at 8 p.m.
Entry.129: - Relieved 39th in Reserve position, going into line tomorrow night.
Entry.130: -Took over front line from 41st Bn, on Villers Brettoneux Front, Bn holding right of British Line.
Entry.131: - Went around line, also visited French on left.
Entry.132:
- Usual activity on both sides. Had French Bn Cdr & his 2nd in C

to dinner, very cordial relations are existing at present.
Entry.133: -Went around line with Wisdom, preparations for a stunt.
Entry.134: -Dined with French 3rd Zouaves, very pleasant evening, had some casualties on patrol.
Entry.135: -A year ago today since The General was killed - went around line with Lloyd.
Entry.136: - All preparations made for stunt tomorrow morning & a few Yanks are to be used with our men.
Entry.137: -Fight commenced at 3.40 A.M., great success all objectives taken & 1500 prisoners. Robbie returned from Paris.
Entry.138: - Came out of line for spell, Robinson taking over, at Transport lines.
Entry.139: - Saw Martin now B.G., received letter stating appln. for return to Australia approved. Wrote to Doff. Went to 7th Bde Concert.
Entry.140: - Lunched at Division, went to Bde & said farewell to Wisdom & party, then to Battalion & had a last meal with them.
Entry.141: - Left by car for Boulogne, shared a room with Scott at Folkestone Hotel.
Entry.142: - Left Boulogne at 2.15 p.m., arrived London, stayed at Morley's Hotel.
Entry.143: - Went to A.I.F. H.Qrs, no date fixed for sailing, on leave until 24.7.18, saw the Bamfords.
Entry.144: - Ordered some mufti and bought some clothes, went to "Yes Uncle".
Entry.145: -Had dinner at Aust Club then went to Murrays for supper with Mills.
Entry.146: - Left for Scotsland Farm at Bramley, met Webb Ware who drove me around.
Entry.147: - Went for another drive with Webb Ware, had supper (good) with Dr. Fox.
Entry.148: - Went to Godalming with Webb Ware, and also saw some of his ponies.
Entry.149: -Went to Guilford with Currie, in afternoon went to Bramley with Webb Ware who went up to London.
Entry.150: - Did a bit of hay making & exercised mare "Mayfair".
Entry.151: - On invitation had supper with Mrs Lathbury, very interesting old lady.
Entry.152: - Went to London for try on at tailors, had dinner at Club & then went to "Bing Boys on Broadway".
Entry.153: - Went to A.I.F. H.Qrs, no news of Ship yet, returned to Farm in afternoon.
Entry.154: - Exercised "Mayfair", had a long talk with Daniel Edwards who is peculiarly English.
Entry.156: - Raining heavily. Wrote to Doff telling her of my intended return.
Entry.157: - Orders received to report for duty at H.Qrs London, arrived at 6 pm from Godalming. Went to the Alhambra.
Entry.158: - President of D.C.M's on 9 cases. Went to National Sporting Club at night.
Entry.159: - Took Pattie Bamford to tea & afterwards spent the night at Malden.
Entry.160: - Took Hetty for the Week end to the farm at Bramley.
Entry.162: - Went back to Malden with Hetty, reported to H.Qrs, orders to proceed to Plymouth as O.C. Troops tomorrow.
Entry.163: - Had lunch with Mr & Mrs Gray, bought a watch for Doff, left by 4 p.m. train from Paddington for Plymouth.
Entry.164:
-Took over as O/C Troops on D17 (Malta).

970 (Nurses, Officers, OR & Munition Workers), pulled out into stream at 6 p.m., had Boat Stations Drill at 8 p.m.
